strings.onboardLongDescription: With huge cliffs and its iconic Opera House, Sydney's wow effect makes it one of the greatest port cities. Whether exploring the Rocks district or people-watching in Bondi Beach, you'll find that Sydney mixes elegance and laid-back vibes like a pro.

agendaPreview.noBookingText: You don’t currently have any bookings for this day. Go ahead and fill your boots!

activities.shortDescription: See the Opera House, Bondi, & more en route home
activities.longDescription: With its distinctive sail-like roof, the imposing building dominates the harbor. A guide will take you through its history, design, and its role in Sydney's cultural landscape, and you'll head next to The Gap, a local name for the south head of the entrance to Sydney Harbor. The spectacular views across the gap between the harbor's north and south heads make for memorable photos. Last but not least, enjoy free time (plus more memorable photos) at Australia's best-known surf spot, Bondi Beach.
highlightDetails: Go behind the scenes at the iconic Sydney Opera House
Enjoy the sun and sand at Bondi Beach, the legendary surfer hangout
Take a scenic drive to Watson's Bay, and get stunning harbor and city views from the lookout point known as "The Gap"
activities.introduction: Wrap up your voyage in style with a day exploring Sydney's greatest hits — kicked off with a bang by a guided tour of the city's iconic Opera House.
instructionDetails: This Shore Thing is for Sailors with domestic flights after 3:30pm and international flights after 5:00pm
Sailors in wheelchairs or with limited mobility should not select this Shore Thing
Large bags are not allowed in the Opera House, but free lockers are available to Sailors during this Shore Thing
This tour operator has received third party certification based on the Global Sustainable Tourism Council criteria

tourDifferentiators.name: Sustainable Tours
tourDifferentiators.description: This tour operator has received third-party certification based on the Global Sustainable Tourism Council criteria.

activities.displayName: Hop On Hop Off Bus Tour with Luggage Storage
activities.shortDescription: No-fuss city tour with bonus luggage storage
activities.longDescription: With an audio guide offering eight language options, you can learn Sydney's history on either of two exciting routes: the Sydney Tour Red Route (covering the inner city surrounding Darling Harbor), or the Bondi Route (a coastal adventure through Sydney's Eastern bays to its iconic Bondi Beach). Buses arrive at each of the 30+ stops every 30-45 minutes minutes, which means plenty of chances to hop off and take in some culture or shopping before you collect your bags and head to the airport.
highlightDetails: Enjoy an all-day pass to see the city from an open-top bus
Relax and travel light, leaving your luggage behind at a secure storage location
Learn about Sydney in any of the 8 languages offered in the audioguide
Choose between the Sydney Tour Route, to explore the inner city, or the Bondi Tour, for a coastal adventure to the beach through Sydney's Eastern bays
activities.introduction: Stash your bags in a nearby luggage shop and head out for a day of easy, breezy sightseeing on a double-decker bus through Australia's capital city.
instructionDetails: International flights should be at 2:00pm or later
Multilingual audio guide (offered in 8 languages)
Buses arrive at each of the 30+ stops every 30-45 minutes
The tour ticket is valid for the entire day
Transfer to the airport not included. Staff will be on hand to assist with taxi dispatch if needed
This Shore Thing is wheelchair accessible for collapsible wheelchairs, as well as Sailors who can navigate a few steps on their own

activities.shortDescription: Secure a spot on a local shuttle to the airport
activities.longDescription: Reserve a spot in advance on a shuttle that will transfer you from the cruise terminal to Sydney International Airport. After clearing customs at the terminal, there will be a shuttle reserved just for Virgin Voyages Sailors. Make sure each person in your travel party reserves a spot — reservations are per Sailor, not per cabin.
highlightDetails: Secure your space on a shuttle that will take you from the ship terminal to the airport
activities.introduction: Arrange a spot in advance on an airport shuttle that will transport you from the terminal to Sydney International Airport.
instructionDetails: Sailors must pre-book for themselves (per Sailor) — not per cabin
Traffic delays are possible en route to the airport - please plan accordingly
Please make sure that the transfer's scheduled departure allows sufficient time for international and domestic flights
This Shore Thing is wheelchair accessible for collapsible wheelchairs, as well as Sailors who can navigate a few steps on their own
Approximately 1-hour drive to SYD airport

activities.displayName: Blue Mountains National Park (& Airport Transfer)
activities.shortDescription: Panoramic mountain views and a convenient drop-off
activities.longDescription: Winding through towns that serve as weekend escapes for Sydney-dwellers, you'll reach Blue Mountains National Park. From the lookout point, there are sweeping views of the surrounding valley and its unique geological formations. There, you'll board the world's steepest perpendicular railway to get up close and personal with the Jamison Valley floor (before returning to the top via cable car). Head to nearby Leura for free time, lunch, and craft & antique shopping before driving to the airport.
highlightDetails: Ascend into Australia's famous Blue Mountains to see the famous Three Sisters, a rock formation with three towering pinnacles
Take in panoramic views of Jamison Valley, Mount Solitary, the Ruined Castle, Katoomba Falls, and the Burraborang Valley — all from a lookout point
Ride down into the valley on the world's steepest perpendicular railway, then return to the top by cable car
Enjoy free time in Leura, a charming town situated right outside the national park, for lunch and shopping
Drive past essential Sydney sights on your way to the airport
activities.introduction: Following the trail of Australia's early explorers, you'll head west of the nation's capital and climb high into the Blue Mountains.
instructionDetails: Approximately 2 hours of free time at Scenic World to explore
Approximately 1 hour and 15 minutes of free time in Leura to shop, eat, and explore
Approximately 1 hour and 45-minute drive each way to/from the pier
Approximately 2 hour and 15-minute drive back to Sydney and the airport
Lunch is not included — take advantage of the free time to taste the local cuisine
This experience is not recommended for Sailors with a fear of heights or vertigo
The order of sites visited may vary
Sailors in wheelchairs or with limited mobility should not select this Shore Thing
Sailors' flight departure times should be after 5:30pm for domestic flights and after 6:30pm for international
This Shore Thing operator has received third-party certification based on the Global Sustainable Tourism Council criteria

tourDifferentiators.description: This tour operator has received third-party certification based on the Global Sustainable Tourism Council criteria.
